q_tec_001.question: Who is credited with inventing the telephone?
q_tec_001.hint: His famous first words on it were 'Mr. Watson, come here.'
q_tec_001.explanation: Alexander Graham Bell patented the telephone in 1876.

q_tec_002.question: What does 'HTTP' stand for?
q_tec_002.hint: You see it at the beginning of website addresses.
q_tec_002.explanation: HTTP is the foundation of data communication on the World Wide Web.

q_tec_003.question: In what year was the first iPhone released?
q_tec_003.hint: Steve Jobs unveiled it at Macworld in San Francisco.
q_tec_003.explanation: Apple released the first iPhone on June 29, 2007.

q_tec_004.question: What programming language is known for its use in web browsers?
q_tec_004.hint: Despite its name, it's not related to Java; it runs in browsers.
q_tec_004.explanation: JavaScript is the primary language for interactive web content in browsers.

q_tec_005.question: Who founded Microsoft?
q_tec_005.hint: They started the company in 1975 in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
q_tec_005.explanation: Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded Microsoft in 1975.

q_tec_006.question: What does 'Wi-Fi' stand for?
q_tec_006.hint: This technology allows devices to connect to the internet without cables.
q_tec_006.explanation: Wi-Fi stands for Wireless Fidelity and uses radio waves to provide network connectivity.

q_tec_007.question: Which company developed the Android operating system?
q_tec_007.hint: This company's name is also a mathematical term for 10 to the power of 100.
q_tec_007.explanation: Google acquired Android Inc. in 2005 and released the first Android phone in 2008.

q_tec_008.question: What was the first programmable computer called?
q_tec_008.hint: It was created by Konrad Zuse in Germany in 1941.
q_tec_008.explanation: The Z3, completed in 1941 by Konrad Zuse, is considered the world's first working programmable, fully automatic computer.

q_tec_009.question: What does 'GPS' stand for?
q_tec_009.hint: This satellite-based navigation system was originally developed by the US military.
q_tec_009.explanation: GPS (Global Positioning System) uses a network of satellites to provide location and time information anywhere on Earth.

q_tec_010.question: Who is known as the father of the World Wide Web?
q_tec_010.hint: He invented it at CERN in 1989 and created the first web browser.
q_tec_010.explanation: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web in 1989 while working at CERN in Switzerland.

q_tec_011.question: What does 'USB' stand for?
q_tec_011.hint: This standard connector is used to connect peripherals like keyboards and flash drives.
q_tec_011.explanation: USB (Universal Serial Bus) was introduced in 1996 to standardize the connection of peripherals to computers.

q_tec_012.question: Which company created the first commercially successful personal computer?
q_tec_012.hint: The Apple II, released in 1977, was one of the first mass-produced microcomputers.
q_tec_012.explanation: Apple's Apple II (1977) was one of the first highly successful mass-produced personal computers, helping launch the PC revolution.

q_tec_013.question: What does 'AI' stand for in computing?
q_tec_013.hint: This field aims to create machines that can learn, reason, and make decisions like humans.
q_tec_013.explanation: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a branch of computer science focused on creating systems capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence.

q_tec_014.question: Which company developed ChatGPT?
q_tec_014.hint: This AI research lab was co-founded by Sam Altman and launched ChatGPT in November 2022.
q_tec_014.explanation: OpenAI developed ChatGPT, a large language model chatbot launched in November 2022 that became the fastest-growing consumer application in history.

q_tec_015.question: What does 'SSD' stand for in computer storage?
q_tec_015.hint: Unlike traditional hard drives, this storage has no moving parts and is much faster.
q_tec_015.explanation: SSD (Solid State Drive) uses flash memory with no mechanical parts, offering faster read/write speeds and greater durability than traditional HDDs.

q_tec_016.question: What does 'RAM' stand for in computing?
q_tec_016.hint: It is a type of volatile computer memory.
q_tec_016.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) is a form of temporary storage that allows data to be read and written in any order, and is erased when the computer is turned off.

q_tec_017.question: What does 'LED' stand for?
q_tec_017.hint: This technology is used in modern TV screens, light bulbs, and smartphone displays.
q_tec_017.explanation: LED (Light Emitting Diode) is a semiconductor device that emits light when current flows through it, widely used for energy-efficient lighting.

q_tec_018.question: In what year was the first email sent?
q_tec_018.hint: Ray Tomlinson sent it over ARPANET, the precursor to the internet.
q_tec_018.explanation: Ray Tomlinson sent the first email in 1971 using ARPANET. He also introduced the '@' symbol for email addresses.

q_tec_019.question: What does 'PDF' stand for?
q_tec_019.hint: Adobe developed this file format in the early 1990s.
q_tec_019.explanation: PDF (Portable Document Format) was created by Adobe in 1992 to present documents consistently across different devices and platforms.

q_tec_020.question: Which technology is named after a 10th-century Scandinavian king?
q_tec_020.hint: This wireless technology is used for short-range data transfer between devices.
q_tec_020.explanation: Bluetooth is named after Harald Bluetooth, a 10th-century Danish king who united warring factions, symbolizing the technology's goal of uniting communication protocols.

q_tec_021.question: What does 'HTML' stand for?
q_tec_021.hint: This is the standard language used to create and structure content on web pages.
q_tec_021.explanation: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) was created by Tim Berners-Lee in 1991 and is the foundational language for all web pages.

q_tec_022.question: Who co-founded Apple alongside Steve Jobs?
q_tec_022.hint: This engineer built the Apple I computer by hand in a garage.
q_tec_022.explanation: Steve Wozniak co-founded Apple with Steve Jobs and Ronald Wayne in 1976. Wozniak designed the Apple I and Apple II computers.

q_tec_023.question: In what year was Wikipedia launched?
q_tec_023.hint: Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger created this free online encyclopedia.
q_tec_023.explanation: Wikipedia was launched on January 15, 2001, by Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger. It has since become the largest encyclopedia ever compiled.
